text: The voiced palatal nasal is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is `⟨J⟩.` English does not have this sound but Spanish does, where it is represented by "ñ". == Features == == Examples == Language Word IPA Meaning !Kung — — Albanian 'one' Aranda — — Basque 'female teacher' Bengali /anycal 'area' Burmese /nya 'right(-hand side)' Catalan 'year' Chinese Mandarin 'woman' Sichuanese Wu / Shanghai dialect /nyú nyǐnh Czech 'horse' Dinka nyɔt 'very' Dutch 'orange' French 'belligerent' Galician 'wine' Greek 'New Year's Day' Haketia 'spiritual' Hindustani Hindi //pañchī 'bird' Urdu /pañchī Hungarian 'mother' Italian Standard 'bath' Romanesco dialect 'nothing' Irish inné 'yesterday' Japanese / 'garden' Khasi 'snake' Khmer / 'full' Korean / 'evening' Kurdish Southern /yanyza 'eleven' Latvian 'cloudy' Macedonian /češanje 'itching' Malagasy — — Malay 'a lot' Malayalam ഞാൻ/ñān 'I' Mapudungun 'spiced blood' North Frisian Mooring 'to fly' Norwegian Northern 'man' Southern Occitan Northern 'Poland' Southern Gascon banh 'bath' Polish 'horse' Portuguese Many dialectsConsiderações sobre o status das palato-alveolares em português , p. 12. 'Sonia' Brazilian 'to dream' European 'to scratch' Quechua 'I' Romanian Transylvanian dialects 'dog' Scottish Gaelic 'sing' Serbo- Croatian / 'to her' Slovak 'liver' Spanish 'Spanish' Swahili nyama 'meat' Tamil ஞாயிறு/ñāyiru 'Sunday' Tyap 'animal' Ukrainian /tin' 'shadow' Vietnamese 'house' West Frisian 'next to' Yi / nyi 'sit' Zulu inyoni 'bird' ==Notes== ==References== * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Category:Consonants
